docs.snippet: News about the hottest new computer and video game titles is filling Web sites devoted to the subject. As it was at the Electronic Entertainment Exposition in Los Angeles last week, much of the talk is about coming titles that are expected to be big...
docs.lead_paragraph: News about the hottest new computer and video game titles is filling Web sites devoted to the subject. As it was at the Electronic Entertainment Exposition in Los Angeles last week, much of the talk is about coming titles that are expected to be big sellers. The anticipated games include Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, from Universal Interactive; James Bond 007: Nightfire, keyed to a Bond film coming in November, and new versions of popular franchises like Tony Hawk, Star Wars and John Madden football.
docs.abstract: News about hottest new computer and video game titles is filling Web sites devoted to subject; Michael Gartenberg of Jupiter Media Metrix notes that traffic to game Web sites has increased as people spend more time with video games; graphs (S)

docs.snippet: Sony held a gathering in New York City to introduce its new PlayStation, but it did not unveil the console and did not say when it would go on sale.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sony held a gathering in New York City to introduce its new PlayStation, but it did not unveil the console and did not say when it would go on sale.
docs.abstract: Sony holds gathering in New York City to introduce its new PlayStation 4, but does not unveil the console or say when it will go on sale; console will have difficult time, as industry sales peaked in 2008 with 55 million units, falling to 34 million in 2012.

headline.main: With PlayStation 4, Sony Aims for Return to Glory
headline.print_headline: With PlayStation 4, Sony Hopes to Regain Past Glory

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and DAVID STREITFELD

docs.snippet: Resident Evil 5 is violent and gorgeous and gory all at the same time. It just isn’t racist.
docs.lead_paragraph: Let's get this out of the way: Resident Evil 5 is not a racist game. For at least a year some black journalists have been wringing their hands about whether the game, the latest in the seminal survival-horror series, inflames racist stereotypes because it is set in Africa. The answer is no.

headline.main: There's No Time to Rest Until the Last Zombie in Africa Is Toast

docs.snippet: Microsoft beat Apple to the punch with voice command software that can operate a TV, but by the time Apple TVs show up, probably in 2013, both Apple's Siri and Microsoft's voice commands will be far more sophisticated. But that's only the beginning....
docs.lead_paragraph: Television, and, for that matter, a whole lot of other devices, including cellphones and cars, are about to get more perceptive.
docs.abstract: Microsoft beat Apple to the punch with voice command software that can operate a TV, but by the time Apple TVs show up, probably in 2013, both Apple's Siri and Microsoft's voice commands will be far more sophisticated. But that's only the beginning. Computers will soon be able to read subtle human gestures.

headline.main: Disruptions: A TV That Can Read Me
